greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Don't be greedy! Difference between number of squares needed to sum to n using the greedy algorithm and using the best such sum.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
example: a(32)=5-2=3 since 32 can be written greedily as 25+4+1+1+1 or efficiently as 16+16.
mathematica: f[n_] := (n - Floor[Sqrt[n]]^2); a053610[n_] := (m = n; c = 1; While[a = f[m]; a != 0, c++; m = a]; c); SquareCnt[n_] := If[SquaresR[1, n] > 0, 1, If[SquaresR[2, n] > 0, 2, If[SquaresR[3, n] > 0, 3, 4]]]; (* a002828 *) Table[a053610[n] - SquareCnt[n], {n, 1, 100}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 18 2017 *)
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jun 25 2001
